Bash(git -C .. commit -m "fix: Add /patterns proxy to Vite config for pattern images

The pattern images were returning as text/html (index.html fallback)
instead of image/png because Vite dev server wasn''t proxying
/patterns/* requests to the backend.

Added proxy configuration:
  ''/patterns'': {
    target: ''http://localhost:8080'',
    changeOrigin: true,
  }

This fixes the issue where PieceVisualizer component couldn''t
load pattern images from the backend.

Before: HTTP 304 text/html 659B (index.html)
After:  HTTP 200 image/png 1-7KB (actual PNG)

Bash(git -C .. commit -m "fix: Change PieceVisualizer to use diagonal triangles instead of quadrants

Changed from 4 corner quadrants to 4 diagonal triangles using CSS clip-path.
Each pattern now extends from center to edge, creating the proper
diagonal division like in the original edge_puzzle visualization.

Clip-path polygons:
- North: Triangle from center to top edge (0%,0% â†’ 100%,0%)
- East: Triangle from center to right edge (100%,0% â†’ 100%,100%)  
- South: Triangle from center to bottom edge (100%,100% â†’ 0%,100%)
- West: Triangle from center to left edge (0%,100% â†’ 0%,0%)

This matches the expected Eternity II piece visualization format.

Bash(git -C .. commit -m "fix: Mirror pattern images using nested divs for proper alignment

Separated clip-path (triangle shape) from transform (pattern mirror):
- Outer div: clip-path defines triangle boundary
- Inner div: background-image with scaleX/scaleY transforms

Pattern transforms:
- North/South: scaleY(-1) for vertical mirror
- East/West: scaleX(-1) for horizontal mirror

This allows the triangle shape to stay fixed while only
the pattern image is mirrored for edge alignment.

Bash(git -C .. commit -m "wip: Document edge_puzzle algorithm - needs 45Â° rotation for diamonds

Analysis of edge_puzzle ui.py reveals the algorithm:

1. Create 512Ã—512 surface (2Ã— pattern size = 2Ã—256)
2. Place 4 rotated patterns in 2Ã—2 grid:
   - Top-left: North (0Â°)
   - Top-right: East (270Â°)
   - Bottom-left: South (90Â°)
   - Bottom-right: West (180Â°)
3. Rotate ENTIRE surface by 45Â° â†’ creates diamond shape
4. Crop center portion to get square with diagonal triangles
5. Scale to display size

Current CSS approach uses clip-path triangles but misses
the 45Â° rotation step. Need different strategy tomorrow:
- Option A: Use CSS rotate(45deg) on container
- Option B: Use HTML5 Canvas for exact replication
- Option C: Pre-generate rotated images server-side

Bash(git -C /Users/laurentzamofing/dev/eternity commit -m "feat: Use pre-rendered piece images for perfect visualization

Switched from compositing pattern images to using complete
pre-rendered piece images (001.png - 256.png) from edge_puzzle.

Changes:
- Copy 256 pre-rendered piece images to static/pieces/
- Simplify PieceVisualizer to display single image per piece
- Add /pieces proxy to vite.config.ts
- Handle rotation by rotating entire piece image
- Counter-rotate label to keep it readable

Benefits:
- Perfect visual match with edge_puzzle (45Â° algorithm applied)
- Simpler code (no complex CSS transforms)
- Correct pattern alignment guaranteed
- Better performance (single image vs 4 composited)

Images are ~340Ã—334 PNG with diagonal pattern divisions.
